FINANCE DIRECTOR AND TREASURER
Professional Summary

SKILLS

Exceptional interpersonal communication Effective leader Project management Financial management
Fiscal budgeting Customer service-oriented Team building Human resources management
Work History
Finance Director and Treasurer ,

09/1998 to 09/2008
Company Name
— City , State
Supervise all units in the Finance Department including revenue, budget, purchasing, general ledger accounting, accounts payable and receivable, payroll and utility billing.
Direct the treasury functions for the City and South County Regional Wastewater Authority (SCRWA), including the preparation and review of periodic investment reports and the oversight of the City's investment portfolio.
Performed qualitative and quantitative analysis of alternatives for addressing the City's unfunded pension liability.
Review of retroactive payroll calculations for fire, safety and exempt personnel.
Coordinate the financial audit.
Direct the preparation and comprehensive review of the annual City financial report, SCRWA financial report and the Transportation Development Act report.
Review of routine and one-time journal entries, while concluding whether the accounting used was in accordance with governmental accounting standards.
Search for potential grants for all departments.
Preparation of several operating budgets.
Assist in the management and maintenance of public facility and pass-through bonds.
Partnered successfully with [departments, clients] to produce [positive outcome] .
Initiated rollout of new enterprise software solution for sales reporting.
Trained, coached and mentored staff to ensure smooth adoption of new program.
Financial Services Officer/Budget Officer ,

10/1997 to 09/1998
Company Name
— City , State
Management of fiscal duties, provision of complex staff assistance to esponsible for all SEC and external financial reporting for Calpine Corporation.
Extensive direct experience with the SEC, including correspondences and conference calls with the Division of Corporation Finance, the Office of the Chief Accountant and the Division of Enforcement.
Designed, implemented and managed the Sarbanes-Oxley program for the Company's SEC reporting, including controls documentation and coordination with internal and external auditors.
Lead role in public filings of senior notes, convertible debt, zero-coupon debentures, lease obligation bonds and equity.
Total deal experience of approximately $20 billion.
Author and file Forms 10-K, 10-Q, 8-K and related 1934 Act forms.
Ensure compliance with international filing requirements.
Review stand-alone financial statements for subsidiaries, including an SEC registrant.
Assist management in preparing for quarterly analyst calls with comprehensive financial and operating information.
Draft quarterly earnings releases and review power point presentations for analyst call presentations.
Calculation of earnings per share and other key financial measures on a monthly basis.
Support Investor Relations and Public Relations in answering financial questions from institutional and retail investors and the media.
Research sensitive accounting issues and provide technical support to corporate accounting group and to regional controllers.
Frequent interface with Legal, Human Resources, Financial Planning and Analysis and Treasury/Compliance.
Primary contact with external auditors for comfort letters for securities offerings.
Management of accounting for interest rate swaps under SFAS 133.
Responsible for ensuring consistency of application of capitalized interest under SFAS 34.
Responsible for Stock Administration.

<JD_START>
Job Title: Global Product Line Manager

Location: Pennsylvania, United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Marketing, Product Management

Description:
Location: Etters, Pennsylvania Posted: 03/18/2024 Location Name: Valley Green

Wage: Depends on Experience

Position Title: Global Product Line Manager; Cabled Backplane Systems

Location: Valley Green, PA

Amphenol High Speed Products Group is the market leader for high speed, high bandwidth electrical connectors for the Telecom/Datacom market (Mobile Networks, Storage, Servers, Routers, Switches, etc.). Our products help to enable the electronics revolution and remain a key enabler for all the major Tier 1 OEMs globally. We are currently seeking a high energy Global Product Line Manager to join our team located in our Etters, PA office.

The Global Product Line Manager will be responsible for the full P&L of the existing Cabled Backplane Systems portfolio, including growing revenue and driving the development of new products, markets, and customers. The candidate will work closely with the global Amphenol sales team to identify, develop, and capture business opportunities worldwide.

Responsibilities 

Develop and execute a strategy to launch and grow the product line, including setting the strategic vision for the product line, defining and executing product roadmaps, translating market/customer needs into product definitions/requirements and developing go-to-market strategiesDrive new business development in new markets and customers for the product line and expanding opportunities in Amphenol’s existing customer baseWork closely with global sales, field application engineering and marketing teams to develop tools and support material to facilitate new design winsDrive product training and sales promotions to gain new opportunitiesUnderstand current industry applications and map future industry trends and translate into a product plan and roadmapAnalyze competitors and competitor products. Identify and implement actions to outperform competition from a technology and commercial perspectiveWork with global cross-functional teams such as engineering, manufacturing, supply chain, and quality to drive the growth and customer satisfaction of the assigned product line, including value engineering initiatives, customized designs to meet customer requirements, managing quality issues, etcUnderstand customers’ technology needs, strategic direction and develop/execute a plan to ensure the Cable Backplane Systems team is positioned with the right product, at the right time, with the right pricing strategy to meet the customer’s needsThink and act as a business owner, forecasting bookings/revenues, pricing strategies, performing competitive analysis, and evaluating key capital investment ROI.Own the business plan for designated product family through:Life cycle management/rationalization, PCNsCost, pricing and margin managementCapacity planning managementInvolvement in NPD and Product Extension projectsNew business opportunitiesInitiate capital justification for new product development and extension by rationalizing investment versus business potentials, risk analysis, and payback optimizationFully target KPIs for sales revenue achievement, product margin improvement on cost reduction, design win, and shortening response time to quoteAttend industry events to promote the product and assist in developing marketing material This position requires local and international travel, including to Asia, for customer visits, product development meetings, and factory visits
Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in Business, Bachelor’s degree in Electrical/Mechanical Engineering or MBA preferred2+ years of product management and business development experience3+ years of experience working in the interconnect industry preferredAbility to lead global cross-functional teams and bridge functional/organizational gapsExcellent organizational and communication skills, ability to lead and navigate dynamic environmentsDemonstrated ability to work cross-functionally with global and multicultural teams in marketing, engineering, quality, manufacturing, vendors, and customersStrong technical aptitude combined with business acumenAbility to influence change in thought and behavior across all functionsProficiency in Microsoft office products such as Outlook, Excel, and PowerPoint

Amphenol Corporation is proud of our reputation as an excellent employer. Our main focus is to provide the highest level of support and responsiveness to both our employees and our customers, the world's largest technology companies. Amphenol Corporation offers the opportunity for career growth within a global organization. We believe that Amphenol Corporation is unique in that every employee, regardless of his or her position, has the ability to positively impact the business.

Amphenol is an “Equal Opportunity Employer” - Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity/National Origin

For additional company information please visit our website at https://www.amphenol-cs.com/

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
<JD_END>
